channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BEAM-3357] Python SDK head fails to run tests due to Requirement.parse('protobuf<=3.4.0,>=3.2.0')
item.description:
Error is:

running build_ext
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "setup.py", line 202, in <module>
'test': generate_protos_first(test),
File "/Users/chamikara/testing/test_py_12_14_2017_2/env_proto_3.4/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/_init_.py", line 129, in setup
return distutils.core.setup(**attrs)
File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 151, in setup
dist.run_commands()
File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 953, in run_commands
self.run_command(cmd)
File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 972, in run_command
cmd_obj.run()
File "setup.py", line 142, in run
super(cmd, self).run()
File "/Users/chamikara/testing/test_py_12_14_2017_2/env_proto_3.4/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/test.py", line 225, in run
with self.project_on_sys_path():
File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 17, in _enter_
return self.gen.next()
File "/Users/chamikara/testing/test_py_12_14_2017_2/env_proto_3.4/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/test.py", line 164, in project_on_sys_path
require('%s==%s' % (ei_cmd.egg_name, ei_cmd.egg_version))
File "/Users/chamikara/testing/test_py_12_14_2017_2/env_proto_3.4/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/_init_.py", line 984, in require
needed = self.resolve(parse_requirements(requirements))
File "/Users/chamikara/testing/test_py_12_14_2017_2/env_proto_3.4/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources/_init_.py", line 875, in resolve
raise VersionConflict(dist, req).with_context(dependent_req)
pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict: (protobuf 3.5.0.post1 (/Users/chamikara/testing/test_py_12_14_2017_2/beam/sdks/python/.eggs/protobuf-3.5.0.post1-py2.7.egg), Requirement.parse('protobuf<=3.4.0,>=3.2.0'), set(['apache-beam']))

Seems like grpcio did a release today which is breaking us: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/grpcio/1.8.1

We have to either bump our protobuf dependency or reduce the upper bound of grpcio dependency to previous release (1.7.3).
item.summary: Python SDK head fails to run tests due to Requirement.parse('protobuf<=3.4.0,>=3.2.0')

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: cc: altay charleschen robertwb udim

Let's pin grpcio until we understand what is happening. (reduce upper bound to previous release)

This will break, all existing releases. Am I wrong?

aaltay opened a new pull request #4268: BEAM-3357 Add grpcio upper bound
URL: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4268

Latest grpcio 1.8.1 is not compatible with the protobuf version beam depends on.

R: @chamikaramj @robertwb

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
Do we know why we place an upper limit on protobuf?

I do not know if we have legitimate reason for putting an upper bound on protobuf. I will look at other dependencies and see if we can move the upper bound to the next major version.

I am still in favor of pinning grpcio to restore the previous state before making another change.

aaltay opened a new pull request #4273: BEAM-3357 Add grpcio upper bound
URL: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4273

R: @chamikaramj @robertwb

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

It does not look like we need to have an upper bound for protobuf. Other than beam package there are not dependencies that need to work with <= 3.3.0

For reference:
> pipdeptree | grep protobuf
Warning!!! Possibly conflicting dependencies found:

  • grpcio==1.8.1
  • protobuf [required: >=3.5.0.post1, installed: 3.3.0]
    ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  • protobuf [required: >=3.5.0.post1, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.2.0,<=3.3.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.5.0.post1, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0,<4.0dev, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.5.0.post1, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.5.0.post1, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.0.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.3.0, installed: 3.3.0]
  • protobuf [required: >=3.3.0, installed: 3.3.0]

aaltay closed pull request #4273: BEAM-3357 Add grpcio upper bound
URL: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4273

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/sdks/python/gen_protos.py b/sdks/python/gen_protos.py
index 09066ee92e4..8964f3a2b32 100644
— a/sdks/python/gen_protos.py
+++ b/sdks/python/gen_protos.py
@@ -31,8 +31,9 @@
import time
import warnings

-
-GRPC_TOOLS = 'grpcio-tools>=1.3.5'
+# grpcio 1.8.1 requires protobuf >= 3.5
+# TODO(BEAM-3357): Remove the upper bound.
+GRPC_TOOLS = 'grpcio-tools>=1.3.5,<=1.7.3'

BEAM_PROTO_PATHS = [
os.path.join('..', '..', 'model', 'pipeline', 'src', 'main', 'proto'),
diff --git a/sdks/python/setup.py b/sdks/python/setup.py
index b1ec92f1821..53848614d6d 100644
— a/sdks/python/setup.py
+++ b/sdks/python/setup.py
@@ -98,7 +98,9 @@ def get_version():
'avro>=1.8.1,<2.0.0',
'crcmod>=1.7,<2.0',
'dill==0.2.6',

  • 'grpcio>=1.0,<2.0',
    + # grpcio 1.8.1 requires protobuf >= 3.5
    + # TODO(BEAM-3357): Remove the upper bound.
    + 'grpcio>=1.0,<=1.7.3',
    'httplib2>=0.8,<0.10',
    'mock>=1.0.1,<3.0.0',
    'oauth2client>=2.0.1,<4.0.0',

aaltay opened a new pull request #4274: BEAM-3357 Remove upper bound for protobuf
URL: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4274

R: @chamikaramj @robertwb

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
You mean we could bump up the upper bound ? I think we should keep some upper bound in case we get badly broken by a future protobuf release.
I mean we can move the upper bound to <4 (instead of <=3.3.0)

Is this already resolved on the latest master? I still see the error but it looks little different.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 204, in <module>
    'test': generate_protos_first(test),
  File "/Users/redtree1112/.virtualenvs/beam-dev/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 129, in setup
    return distutils.core.setup(**attrs)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 151, in setup
    dist.run_commands()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 953, in run_commands
    self.run_command(cmd)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py", line 972, in run_command
    cmd_obj.run()
  File "setup.py", line 144, in run
    super(cmd, self).run()
  File "/Users/redtree1112/.virtualenvs/beam-dev/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/test.py", line 226, in run
    self.run_tests()
  File "/Users/redtree1112/.virtualenvs/beam-dev/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/command/test.py", line 248, in run_tests
    exit=False,
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/main.py", line 94, in __init__
    self.parseArgs(argv)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/main.py", line 149, in parseArgs
    self.createTests()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/main.py", line 158, in createTests
    self.module)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/loader.py", line 130, in loadTestsFromNames
    suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names]
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/unittest/loader.py", line 91, in loadTestsFromName
    module = __import__('.'.join(parts_copy))
  File "/Users/redtree1112/go/src/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/python/apache_beam/__init__.py", line 86, in <module>
    from apache_beam import coders
  File "/Users/redtree1112/go/src/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/python/apache_beam/coders/__init__.py", line 18, in <module>
    from apache_beam.coders.coders import *
  File "/Users/redtree1112/go/src/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/python/apache_beam/coders/coders.py", line 30, in <module>
    from apache_beam.portability.api import beam_runner_api_pb2
  File "/Users/redtree1112/go/src/github.com/apache/beam/sdks/python/apache_beam/portability/api/beam_runner_api_pb2.py", line 313, in <module>
    options=None, file=DESCRIPTOR),
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'file'

This was fixed by https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4273.

Can you delete generated files in 'apache_beam/portability/api' and retry ? (or try with a clean git clone of Beam)
redtree1112 try removing your Protobuf version and install 3.4.0, I had same the issue due to having 3.5.0 installed.

URL: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4298

… dependencies.

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

  • [ ] Make sure there is a [JIRA issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/BEAM/issues/) filed for the change (usually before you start working on it). Trivial changes like typos do not require a JIRA issue. Your pull request should address just this issue, without pulling in other changes.
  • [ ] Each commit in the pull request should have a meaningful subject line and body.
  • [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue.
  • [ ] Write a pull request description that is detailed enough to understand what the pull request does, how, and why.
  • [ ] Run `mvn clean verify` to make sure basic checks pass. A more thorough check will be performed on your pull request automatically.
  • [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

—
